page.title: 10CHILDREN IN BERE FERRERS
page.content: Two young lads experimenting with a canoe in a little creek that filled with water as the tide came in - this was the scene from the green by the quay at Bere Ferrers.One's first impression is that this area is an idyllic one to grow up in, with woods and space, neighbours to know you, a little shop to buy sweets and ice cream plus a Recreation or "Party" Field with swings and climbing frames for good measure. It's a small village _ perhaps there's a shortage of children of just the right age and Mums may have to be careful that the River Tavy, with its mud flats, does not come unexpectedly close to their offspring. There is a Toddler's Group in the village and then when they are of school age they are taken by 'bus either to Bere Alston or Tavistock.
